title.rendered: Statement on the U.S. Embassy’s Attempts to Pay Electricity Bills

content.rendered: The U.S. Embassy in Ghana has not refused to pay any electricity bills. We have been asking for official bills for embassy-managed facilities for more than two years so we can issue correct payments. The embassy has set aside funds for electricity, and we will continue to work with the ECG to get correct bills so we can pay.
